basics.name: Jiayi Liu
basics.label: Mechanical Engineering Student
basics.summary: B.S. candidate in Mechanical Engineering with a minor in Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa (expected Dec 2026). Interested in soft robotics, mechatronics, and CAD design; experienced in research, leadership, and hands-on prototyping.

education.institution: University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa, Honolulu, HI
education.area: Mechanical Engineering (Minor: Information and Computer Sciences)

work.name: UH Mānoa Department of Mathematics
work.summary: Tutored 46 students in Calculus II through lecture, labs, and office hours.
highlights: Boosted student confidence from 47.1% to 87.5% as shown in recitation survey results.

volunteer.summary: Conduct research on soft robotics and bio-inspired engineering.
highlights: Developed a bio-inspired jellyfish robot, enabling propulsion and grasping in confined underwater environments.
Conducted image processing and data analysis using Python libraries (OpenCV, SciPy, Matplotlib).

volunteer.summary: Led initiatives to grow membership and organize events.
highlights: Revived the chapter with 54 new members (671% growth) and 437% increase in participation.
Secured $4,000 funding and coordinated six technical and networking events.

projects.name: UH Drone Technologies (UHDT) — Air Delivery Subsystem
projects.summary: Collaborated on UAV airdrop and mount designs.
highlights: Designed and 3D printed an airdrop mechanism for four 8-oz bottles, improving success rate by 16%.
Created modular drone component mounts and landing gear.

awards.title: Hawai'i Seal of Biliteracy (English & Chinese Advanced)
Undergraduate Research Opportunities Program (UROP) Funding Recipient
UH Mānoa LA Program New LA Award
